# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split(text,Whitespace())
    
    wrapped_text = ""
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            wrapped_text *= word
        else
            wrapped_text *= " " * word
        end
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped within the maximum text width of 10 characters."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The example demonstrates how `wrap_string` function wraps words within a specified maximum text width. The output shows wrapped text with new lines inserted where necessary.
